etymology.interpretation: A stylized drawing of a spoon with handle and bowl, later simplified into two strokes. Despite visual similarity to parts seen in 老, 眞, and 比, it developed independently and refers specifically to the utensil.

examples.chinese: 古人用匕进食(古人用匕進食)。
examples.english: People in ancient times ate with spoons.

examples.chinese: 他说“勺子”的古称是“匕”(他說「勺子」的古稱是「匕」)。
examples.english: He says the archaic term for a spoon is “匕”.

examples.chinese: 出土的竹简上写有“匕”与“箸”(出土的竹簡上寫有「匕」與「箸」)。
examples.pinyin: Chūtǔ de zhújiǎn shàng xiě yǒu “bǐ” yǔ “zhù”.
examples.english: The excavated bamboo slips bear the characters “匕” and “箸”.
